summary: Build a production-ready full-stack online food ordering web app for the healthy brand “Fal Sarovar” with a premium green/fresh responsive customer storefront (home, menu, cart, checkout, contact) and a secure, beginner-friendly admin panel to manage categories, products, orders, customers, and promo codes, using React+Tailwind (or HTML/CSS/JS) and Firebase (Auth/Database/Hosting), with SEO-friendly fast UX and future-ready payments integration.
architectural_notes: Use Firebase for backend services: Authentication (admin login), Database (products/categories/orders/customers/promo codes), and Hosting.
Frontend to be built with React + Tailwind CSS (or HTML/CSS/JS) with a mobile-first responsive UI.
Design data model to support category/product availability toggles and order status workflow (pending/accepted/completed).
Keep architecture extensible for future payments integration (UPI/cards).

Decide whether customer accounts use Firebase Authentication (email/phone OTP) and add an Account section in the storefront for login/logout and viewing basic customer info/order history (if enabled).

existing_features.title: Implement a modern, clean, premium, mobile-first responsive UI for the Fal Sarovar customer storefront with a cohesive green/fresh visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) applied consistently across all pages.
Create customer-facing pages and navigation for: Home (brand intro, healthy message, best sellers), Menu/Online Store (category-wise listing), Cart, Checkout, and Contact.

Implement editable category management (CRUD) in the admin panel, seeded with these categories: Fruit Salads; Plant-Based Protein Salads; Fresh Juices (No Ice, No Added Sugar); Dairy-Free Smoothies; Detox Drinks; Weight Loss Specials; Weight Gain Meals.

Implement product management with category-wise listing and product detail fields: product name, category, price, description, health benefits, image, and an availability toggle (in stock / out of stock).
Implement a customer cart with add/remove items, quantity controls, and persistent cart state across page refreshes on the same device/session.
Implement promo code input and discount calculation in the cart/checkout flow, backed by admin-managed promo codes supporting flat discount, percentage discount, minimum order value, and expiry date.
Implement checkout to collect customer details (name, mobile number, address), place an order, show an order confirmation screen, and store order data in the backend.

Build a secure, beginner-friendly admin panel with: secure admin login, dashboard overview, product/category CRUD, enable/disable items, order list, customer data + order history, promo code management, and order status updates (pending/accepted/completed).
Provide an order export feature for admins to download order data as CSV (or similar) from the admin panel.
Add an SEO-friendly structure for the customer pages: semantic headings, meaningful page titles/meta descriptions per route, and accessible components (labels, focus states, keyboard navigation).
Optimize perceived performance and loading: lazy-load non-critical routes, optimize and properly size images, and ensure the storefront remains fast on mobile devices.

Design the order data model and UI flow to be easy to extend later for online payments (UPI/cards) without implementing payments now (e.g., include placeholders for payment method/status/transaction reference).

Add customer-facing and admin-facing placeholder/static brand assets and wire them into the UI (logo, home hero/banner, and category imagery) as generated static files under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Add a customer-facing Account entry point to the storefront navigation (desktop + mobile) that reflects authentication state: when signed out, show a clear "Login" action; when signed in, show "Account" and a "Logout" action.

Create a new customer Account page route (e.g., "/account") that allows an authenticated customer to view and edit their profile fields using the existing backend user profile APIs (name, mobile, address).

Ensure customer authentication state changes (login/logout) correctly invalidate and refetch customer-profile-related React Query data so the Account UI always shows the correct user’s data after switching identities.

new_feature_requests.summary: Customer website with modern premium green/fresh theme, mobile-first responsive layout, and pages: Home, Menu/Store, Cart, Checkout, Contact
Menu/catalog system with editable categories and product listing including name, category, price, description, health benefits, image, and in-stock/out-of-stock toggle
Cart and checkout flow: add/remove items, quantity control, promo code input, customer details (name, mobile, address), order confirmation, and admin order notification
Secure admin panel with dashboard overview; CRUD for categories/products; price/description management; enable/disable items; orders list and order status (pending/accepted/completed)
Admin customer data management: view customer info (name/phone/address) and order history
Promo codes management in admin: flat/percentage discounts, minimum order value, expiry date
Order management extras: export order data
Non-functional requirements: SEO-friendly structure, fast loading performance, clean scalable code, and easy future upgrade path for online payments (UPI/cards)
Beginner-friendly admin UX suitable for non-technical owner to manage store content and orders
Implement admin-visible "new order" notification behavior within the app (without external messaging): highlight new orders and provide a clear indicator/count since the last admin view.

Implement backend data models and APIs in the single Motoko actor to support: categories, products (including availability), promo codes, carts/checkout order placement, orders with status, and customer lookup by phone (or derived customer index) for order history.
Add customer account option with login/logout (customer authentication and account entry point in the storefront navigation)

Update backend authorization rules so authenticated non-admin customers can call customer profile endpoints (getCallerUserProfile and saveCallerUserProfile) without hitting authorization traps, while keeping admin-only protections unchanged for admin features.
